rules.natural: Provided that the artwork requires cleaning, the process is completed.
Whenever the conservator follows the publication, the artwork preserves integrity.
If the conservator follows the publication, it is not the case that the artwork maintains integrity.
Either the conservator violates protocol or the conservator does not follow the publication.
In the event that the material requires preparation, the process is completed.
Either the material requires preparation or the technique involves restoration.
Provided that restoration achieves stabilization, the process is completed.
Under the condition that the conservator evaluates the condition, the conservator documents the condition.
Either the conservator evaluates the condition or the conservator assesses the condition.
If the conservator assesses the condition, then in the event that it is not the case that if the technique prevents damage then the technique does not cause damage, the process results in success.
Provided that the conservator documents the condition, then if it is not the case that whenever the technique prevents damage the technique does not cause damage, the process results in success.
Whenever the conservator avoids the method, then if the publication contains instructions, the publication does not contain warnings.
If the conservator selects the method, the conservator avoids the method.
Either the supervisor approves the procedure or the conservator does not follow the publication.
Either the supervisor reviews the procedure or the supervisor does not approve the procedure.
Either the supervisor modifies the procedure or the supervisor does not review the procedure.
Either the conservator certifies the work or, provided that the artwork preserves integrity, the artwork maintains integrity.
Under the condition that the material uses a solvent, the artwork does not require repair.
Either the material uses an adhesive or the material uses a solvent.
If natural phenomena affect deterioration, the process is completed.
Whenever the publication contains instructions, the publication contains warnings.
Under the condition that the conservator possesses skill, the conservator applies a technique.
In the event that the conservator applies a technique, the conservator selects the method.
If it is not the case that if the technique involves restoration then restoration achieves stabilization, the technique causes damage.
Provided that it is not the case that whenever the technique involves restoration restoration achieves stabilization, the technique prevents damage.

Whenever it is not the case that if the conservator applies a technique then, under the condition that the publication contains instructions, the publication does not contain warnings, the conservator follows the publication.
In the event that the artwork does not require cleaning, the artwork requires repair.
If natural phenomena do not affect deterioration, the publication contains instructions.

(A1 → G).natural: Provided that the artwork requires cleaning, the process is completed.

(A10 → A26).natural: Under the condition that the conservator follows the publication, the artwork maintains integrity.

(A10 → A27).natural: Whenever the conservator follows the publication, the artwork preserves integrity.

(A10 → ¬A26).natural: If the conservator follows the publication, it is not the case that the artwork maintains integrity.

(A11 ∨ ¬A10).natural: Either the conservator violates protocol or the conservator does not follow the publication.

(A12 → G).natural: In the event that the material requires preparation, the process is completed.

(A12 ∨ A13).natural: Either the material requires preparation or the technique involves restoration.

(A13 → A14).natural: If the technique involves restoration, restoration achieves stabilization.

(A13 → G).natural: Whenever the technique involves restoration, the process is completed.

(A14 → G).natural: Provided that restoration achieves stabilization, the process is completed.

(A16 → ¬A15).natural: Whenever the technique prevents damage, the technique does not cause damage.

(A18 → (¬(A16 → ¬A15) → A17)).natural: If the conservator evaluates the condition, then provided that it is not the case that if the technique prevents damage then the technique does not cause damage, the process results in success.

(A18 → A20).natural: Under the condition that the conservator evaluates the condition, the conservator documents the condition.

(A18 ∨ A19).natural: Either the conservator evaluates the condition or the conservator assesses the condition.

(A19 → (¬(A16 → ¬A15) → A17)).natural: If the conservator assesses the condition, then in the event that it is not the case that if the technique prevents damage then the technique does not cause damage, the process results in success.

(A20 → (¬(A16 → ¬A15) → A17)).natural: Provided that the conservator documents the condition, then if it is not the case that whenever the technique prevents damage the technique does not cause damage, the process results in success.

(A21 → (A6 → ¬A7)).natural: Whenever the conservator avoids the method, then if the publication contains instructions, the publication does not contain warnings.

(A22 → A21).natural: If the conservator selects the method, the conservator avoids the method.

(A23 ∨ ¬A10).natural: Either the supervisor approves the procedure or the conservator does not follow the publication.

(A24 ∨ ¬A23).natural: Either the supervisor reviews the procedure or the supervisor does not approve the procedure.

(A25 ∨ ¬A24).natural: Either the supervisor modifies the procedure or the supervisor does not review the procedure.

(A27 → A26).natural: If the artwork preserves integrity, the artwork maintains integrity.

(A28 ∨ (A27 → A26)).natural: Either the conservator certifies the work or, provided that the artwork preserves integrity, the artwork maintains integrity.

(A3 → ¬A2).natural: Under the condition that the material uses a solvent, the artwork does not require repair.

(A4 ∨ A3).natural: Either the material uses an adhesive or the material uses a solvent.

(A5 → G).natural: If natural phenomena affect deterioration, the process is completed.

(A6 → A7).natural: Whenever the publication contains instructions, the publication contains warnings.

(A6 → ¬A7).natural: Provided that the publication contains instructions, the publication does not contain warnings.

(A8 → (A6 → ¬A7)).natural: If the conservator possesses skill, then in the event that the publication contains instructions, the publication does not contain warnings.

(A8 → A9).natural: Under the condition that the conservator possesses skill, the conservator applies a technique.

(A9 → (A6 → ¬A7)).natural: If the conservator applies a technique, then provided that the publication contains instructions, the publication does not contain warnings.

(A9 → A21).natural: Whenever the conservator applies a technique, the conservator avoids the method.

(A9 → A22).natural: In the event that the conservator applies a technique, the conservator selects the method.

(¬(A13 → A14) → A15).natural: If it is not the case that if the technique involves restoration then restoration achieves stabilization, the technique causes damage.

(¬(A13 → A14) → A16).natural: Provided that it is not the case that whenever the technique involves restoration restoration achieves stabilization, the technique prevents damage.

(¬(A13 → A14) → ¬A15).natural: Under the condition that it is not the case that if the technique involves restoration then restoration achieves stabilization, the technique does not cause damage.

(¬(A16 → ¬A15) → A17).natural: If it is not the case that provided that the technique prevents damage the technique does not cause damage, the process results in success.

(¬(A9 → (A6 → ¬A7)) → A10).natural: Whenever it is not the case that if the conservator applies a technique then, under the condition that the publication contains instructions, the publication does not contain warnings, the conservator follows the publication.

(¬A1 → A2).natural: In the event that the artwork does not require cleaning, the artwork requires repair.
